intro: Argemone chisosensis, commonly known as Chisos pricklypoppy, is a flowering plant native to the Chisos Mountains in Texas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, spiny stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Argemone chisosensis is considered a rare and endemic species, making it a notable plant in local ecosystems.
